article.title: U.S. Army Invests in Renewable Energy Facilities
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: CMS TotTest Joint Venture, Bargersville, Indiana; ARGO Systems Limited Liability Corporation, Hanover, Maryland; JSR-ECC Limited Liability Corporation, Schertz, Texas; Luevano Hart/Burns and McDonnell Joint Venture, Kansas City, Missouri; and Southwind Construction Services Limited Liability Corporation, Edmond, Oklahoma; were awarded a $49 million firm-fixed-price multiple-award-task-order contract for the construction of renewable energy, energy conservation and mechanical and electrical projects for the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers South Western District. The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Tulsa, Oklahoma, is the contracting activity.
